nodes.text: many Japanese complain against the new more liberal curriculum and deplore the decline in basic standards that they say is undermining Japan's ability to compete in the world.
If Japan's ability to compete is to be maintained  Japan needs a new more liberal curriculum.
These are qualities that the old system often suppressed.
If it is to compete Japan needs an education system that creates individuality and imagination.

If Japan needs an education system that encourages individuality and imagination in order to compete and the current education system supresses these qualities then - if it is to compete Japan needs a more liberal education system.
Japan is no longer essentially a manufacturing economy. Its future is going to depend on value-added products and entrepreneurial flair.

If Japan's future is going to depend on value-added products and entrepreneurial flair and this requires individuality and imagination then  - if it is to compete Japan needs an education system that creates individuality and imagination.
